summary: This is an email from a government attorney to Judge Nathan's chambers, submitting proposed redactions for the US v. Maxwell case (20 CR 330) as referenced in Docket No. 498. It demonstrates the ongoing legal process of document review and sealing in the high-profile case.

persons.name: Nathan
persons.context: The email is addressed to Judge Nathan's chambers, indicating she is presiding over the US v. Maxwell case (20 CR 330).

persons.name: Maxwell
persons.context: The case is US v. Maxwell, indicating Ghislaine Maxwell is the defendant in criminal case 20 CR 330.

connections.description: Judge Nathan is presiding over the criminal case against Ghislaine Maxwell.

events.title: Submission of Proposed Redactions
events.description: The Government submits proposed redactions for the US v. Maxwell case to Judge Nathan's chambers, as referenced in Docket No. 498.

keyFacts: The document is an email dated November 24, 2021, regarding the criminal case US v. Maxwell (20 CR 330).
The Government is submitting proposed redactions for court documents, indicating ongoing efforts to protect sensitive information.
The correspondence is directed to Judge Nathan's chambers, confirming her role as the presiding judge in the case.
The proposed redactions are referenced in Docket No. 498, showing a specific point in the case's procedural history.
